item.title: A major development in Trump's Fed feud is set to happen next week in the Supreme Court
item.description: Supreme Court arguments on Jan. 21 will likely be the next big development for the central bank's quest to maintain independence.

item.title: December core consumer prices rose at a 2.6% annual rate, less than expected
item.description: Excluding volatile food and energy prices, the consumer price index showed a seasonally adjusted 0.2% gain on a monthly basis and 2.6% annually.

item.title: Global central bankers unite in defense of Fed Chair Jerome Powell
item.description: Global central bankers issued a statement Tuesday defending U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell following the launch of a criminal investigation ...

item.title: Trump revealed some of Friday's jobs data early in post the prior day
item.description: The president indicated that private sector payrolls had expanded by 654,000, a total that would have included Friday's jobs count for December.

item.title: Supreme Court holds off on Trump tariff ruling for now â€” what's at stake for economy
item.description: The decision is poised to have far-reaching impacts on not only trade policy but also the U.S. fiscal situation.
